com.twiddles.ganesha.gui
Class GUI

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      com.twiddles.ganesha.gui.GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame

The main application window of Ganesha. Once instanciated it creates the various GUI components that make up the application window and maintains references to them to facilitate communication between the various GUI elements. This class also keeps track of various states relevant to the GUI (such as whether current work has been saved or not).

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

GUI

public GUI()
Initialises the Ganesha application window. This method will create the main application window and populate it with the main GUI elements: the menubar, the toolbar, the resource list and space for resource editing windows.

See Also:
GMenu, GToolbar, ResourceList, GDesktop
Method Detail

getRDF

public RDFFile getRDF()
Returns a reference to the underlying RDF file.

Returns:
reference to the rdf data

getResList

public ResourceList getResList()
Returns the current resource list

Returns:
reference to the resource list

switchLNF

public void switchLNF(java.lang.String lnfName)
Switch the GUI's Look and Feel. This method will make all GUI elements switch their Java Swing Look and Feel to that specified as the parameter.

Parameters:
lnfName - the class name of the Java Swing Look and Feel you wish to switch to

setLoaded

public void setLoaded(boolean loaded)
Set the file loaded state of the GUI. If a file has been (un)loaded in the GUI this method should be called to update the GUI's state accordingly. This method also makes a call to updateGUI() to make any necessary changes to the GUI.

Parameters:
loaded - true: file is loaded; false: no file loaded

setEdited

public void setEdited(boolean edited)
Set whether or not a loaded file was edited since the last save. If a file has been modified in the GUI this method should be called to update the GUI's state accordingly. This method also makes a call to updateGUI() to make any necessary changes to the GUI.

Parameters:
edited - true: file is modified; false: not modified since last save

setSaveEnable

public void setSaveEnable(boolean enabled)
Enable/disable save operations in the GUI. Use this method if save operations should be disabled in the GUI. For example if a read-only file is loaded. This method also makes a call to updateGUI() to make any necessary changes to the GUI.

Parameters:
enabled - enable/disable saving in the GUI

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shutdown the Ganesha application. If a file is loaded and has been modified the user will be prompted to save his work. Upon saving the application will quit.

See Also:
saveFile()

closeFile

public void closeFile()
Close a currently loaded file in the GUI. If the file has been modified the user will be prompted to save his work. Upon saving the file will be closed and the GUI's state and appearance updated accordingly.

See Also:
saveFile()

openFile

public void openFile(java.io.File file)
Open a specified file in the GUI. If the file cannot be opened (if it is not valid RDF/XML or does not have read permission set) the user will be notified. If the file is read-only it will be loaded, but saving will be disabled.

Parameters:
file - the file to open

openFile

public void openFile()
Open a file in the GUI. This will present the user with a file choosing dialog to pick a RDF/XML file to open. The selected file will be read in and stored internally as a RDFFile If there is currently another file loaded and it has been edited the user will be prompted to save his work.

See Also:
openFile(File), saveFile(), setSaveEnable(boolean), RDFFile

newFile

public void newFile()
Start a blank new file. If a modified file is currently loaded the user will be prompted to save his work first. If saving was previously disabled it will be enabled.

See Also:
saveFile()

saveFile

public void saveFile()
Save the currently loaded file under its current filename. If the file is a new one that does not yet have a name saveFileAs() will get called.

See Also:
saveFileAs()

saveFileAs

public void saveFileAs()
Save a file under a new filename. The user will be prompted to choose a new filename to save their work under. Then the file gets saved, saving is enabled (incase it was disabled before) and the GUI is updated accordingly.
